__inputs.name: DS_PROMETHEUS
__inputs.label: Prometheus datasource. When CEEMS LB is enabled, datasource corresponding to CEEMS LB must be configured here.

description: Time series metrics of a k8s pod

options.content:
The following metrics are aggregated over entire pod duration

Average Utilization (%) CPU ${cpu_usage}
CPU Memory ${cpumem_usage}
GPU ${gpu_usage}
GPU Memory ${gpumem_usage}
Energy Consumption (kWh) Host ${cpu_energy}
GPU ${gpu_energy}
Total ${total_energy}
Equivalent Emissions (gms) Emission Factor RTE Elec. Maps W. Time OWID World Avg.
Host ${cpu_emissions_rte} ${cpu_emissions_emaps} ${cpu_emissions_wt} ${cpu_emissions_owid} ${cpu_emissions_global}
GPU ${gpu_emissions_rte} ${gpu_emissions_emaps} ${gpu_emissions_wt} ${gpu_emissions_owid} ${gpu_emissions_global}
Total ${total_emissions_rte} ${total_emissions_emaps} ${total_emissions_wt} ${total_emissions_owid} ${total_emissions_global}

Following table gives different pod meta data

Attribute Value
ID ${uuid}
Name ${name}
Account ${account}
QoS ${qos}
Submit Time ${submit:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS Z}
Start Time ${start:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS Z}
End Time ${end:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS Z}
Elapsed Time ${elapsed}
State ${state}

This dashboard presents the time series metrics of pod ${uuid} running within namespace ${account}. Currently the following time series metrics are available: - **CPU Stats**: - *CPU Usage*: This shows the usage of CPU by the pod and it is estimated using CPU time. In one second interval, if CPU works only for 0.2 seconds, CPU usage will be reported as 20%. If a pod allocates _n_ cpus and uses all _n_ cpus all the time, the usage will be 100% all the time. If the pod uses only _n/2_ cpus or uses _n_ cpus only 50% of time, the resulting CPU usage will be 50%. - *CPU Memory Usage*: This is the percentage of memory used by the pod compared to the memory available within k8s pod. - *Host Energy Usage*: This is the energy consumption estimated based on total energy consumption (excluding GPUs) of the compute node and the resources used by the pod. Thus it includes CPU, CPU memory and other peripherals on the compute node excluding GPUs. The estimation is made using CPU time, memory used by the pod relative to total CPU time and total memory used by the entire node. If there are multiple pods running on the node at a given time, the reported energy consumption is the energy consumed only by the current pod.
- **CPU Performance Stats**: - *CPU Frequency*: The average frequency at which all the cores in the pod allocation are running during the execution of the pod. - *CPU IPC*: Instructions Per Cylce (IPC) gives number of instructions finished per CPU cycle. An IPC value of more than 1 indicates a good performing code. Higher the value of IPC, better the code performance. - *CPU Software Events*: Two different software events are presented: Context switches and CPU migrations. Context switches happens when execution context changes from user mode to kernel mod or *vice-versa*. Context switch is an expensive operation and hence, more context switches means lower performing code. CPU migraion happens when execution of task change from one CPU core to another. Lower is better. - *Page Faults*: Page faults happen when task access a memory region that is not "prepared". A minor page fault happens when page is loaded into the memory but it not mapped. On the otherhand major fault happens when page is not loaded in the memory. Lower is better. Minor page faults will not have huge impact on the performance where as higher major page faults indicates bad memory management by the code. - *Cache Events*: Cache events indicate the cache efficiency of the code. Currently supported events are L1 read misses ratio and LL read/write misses ratio. Lower is better. L1 is first level cache with very fast access times but limited size where LL is last level cache with slower access times but with larger size. A higher miss ratio indicates that the code needs to fetch the data from the memory often indicates bad caching efficiency.
- **GPU Stats**: - *GPU Usage*: This shows the GPU usage reported by [NVML](https://developer.nvidia.com/management-library-nvml). According to [NVML docs](https://docs.nvidia.com/deploy/nvml-api/structnvmlUtilization__t.html#structnvmlUtilization__t), it is percent of time over the past sample period during which one or more kernels was executing on the GPU. - *GPU Memory Usage*: This is the percentage of memory used by the pod compared to the available memory on the GPU. - *GPU Energy Usage*: This is the energy consumption reported by [NVML](https://developer.nvidia.com/management-library-nvml) by the GPU.
- **GPU Profiling Stats**: NVIDIA DCGM [docs](https://docs.nvidia.com/datacenter/dcgm/latest/user-guide/feature-overview.html#profiling-metrics) explains all the presented GPU profiling metrics.
- **IO Stats**: - *Read/Write bandwidths*: Read/Write bandwidths from different compute nodes for different file systems. - *Read/Write Requests*: Number of requests for read/write from different compute nodes for different file systems. - *Read/Write Errors*: Number of errors while executing read/write requests from different compute nodes for different file systems.
- **Profiling**: This is very minimal/low overhead profiling of the code done using eBPF based continuous profiling tool . In a nutshell, the profiler samples the code at a frequency and builds a histogram of data of how many times code executed in different regions of the code. By resolving the regions to the function names, a flame graph is built to show the time spent in each function of the code. For the better resolution of the function names, debug symbols must be included in the application binaries. It is also recommended to include frame pointers using the flag `-fno-omit-frame-pointer` in the compiler options. More details on how to intrepret flame graphs can be found in [Grafana Pyroscope Docs](https://grafana.com/docs/pyroscope/latest/introduction/flamegraphs/).

panels.description: Time series of CPU usage of the pod
panels.title: CPU Utilization

panels.description: Time series of CPU memory usage of the pod
panels.title: CPU Memory Utilization

panels.description: Time series of estimated Host power usage of the pod
panels.title: Host Power Usage

panels.description: Time series of CPU Frequency
panels.title: CPU Frequency

panels.description: Time series of Instructions per Cycle (IPC). A value of more than 1 can be interpreted as good.
panels.title: CPU IPC

panels.description: Time series of CPU Software Events
panels.title: CPU Software Events

panels.description: Time series of Page Fault Events. Major fault happens when memory needs to be fetched from disk where as minor fault happens when memory needs to be mapped. Higher major faults means bad memory performance. Minor faults do not have huge performance impact.
panels.title: Page Fault Events

panels.description: Time series of Cache events. L1 is the smallest and fastest cache whereas LL is the largest and slowest cache. Misses is the percentage of times that data is not found on L1/LL cache and it needs to be fetched from higher caches/memory. A smaller value means the program is using the cache efficiently. A higher value indicates a memory bound program.
panels.title: CPU Cache Events

panels.description: Time series of GPU usage reported by nVIDIA-DCGM for different GPUs in the pod
panels.title: GPU Utilization

panels.description: Time series of GPU memory usage reported by nVIDIA-DCGM for different GPUs in the pod

targets.legendFormat: Average Memory Usage on all GPUs

panels.title: GPU Memory Utilization

panels.description: Time series of GPU power usage reported by nVIDIA-DCGM for different GPUs in the pod
panels.title: GPU Power Usage

panels.description: Time series of GPU SM Activity & Occupancy reported by nVIDIA-DCGM for different GPUs in the pod

targets.legendFormat: Average SM Activity on all GPUs
Average SM Occupancy on all GPUs

panels.title: GPU SM Activity & Occupancy

panels.description: Time series of GPU Graphics and Tensor Engines Activity reported by nVIDIA-DCGM for different GPUs in the pod

targets.legendFormat: Average Graphics Engine Activity on all GPUs
Average Tensor Pipe Activity on all GPUs

panels.title: GPU Graphics and Tensor Engines Activity

panels.description: Time series of GPU FP{64, 32, 16} Engines Activity reported by nVIDIA-DCGM for different GPUs in the pod

targets.legendFormat: Average FP64 Engine Activity on all GPUs
Average FP32 Engine Activity on all GPUs
Average FP16 Engine Activity on all GPUs

panels.title: GPU FP Engines Activity

panels.description: Time series of fraction of cycles where data was sent to or received from GPU reported by nVIDIA-DCGM for different GPUs in the pod

targets.legendFormat: Average Memory BW Utilization on all GPUs

panels.title: GPU Memory BW Utilization

panels.description: Time series of GPU NVLink Bandwidth reported by nVIDIA-DCGM for different GPUs in the pod

targets.legendFormat: Average Transmitted Bandwidth on all GPUs
Average Received Bandwidth on all GPUs

panels.title: GPU NVLink Bandwidth

panels.description: Time series of GPU PCIe Bandwidth reported by nVIDIA-DCGM for different GPUs in the pod

targets.legendFormat: Average Transmitted Bandwidth on all GPUs
Average Received Bandwidth on all GPUs

panels.title: GPU PCIe Bandwidth

panels.description: Time series of Read/Write Bandwidth to different file systems.
panels.title: IO Read/Write Bandwidth

panels.description: Time series of Read/Write Requests to different file systems.
panels.title: IO Read/Write Requests

panels.description: Time series of Read/Write Errors to different file systems.
panels.title: IO Read/Write Errors

panels.description: Time series of Pod Network Ingress/Egress Bandwidth.
panels.title: Network Ingress/Egress Bandwidth

panels.description: Time series of Pod Network Ingress/Egress Packets.
panels.title: Network Ingress/Egress Packets

panels.description: Time series of total CPU time for all hosts in the pod
panels.title: CPU Time

panels.description: Flame graph of pod profiling made using CEEMS eBPF profiler.
panels.title: Profile

title: Single Pod Metrics
